physical_examinations.vital_signs: Weight: 30.8 kg; Height: 119.5 cm; Blood Pressure: 112/70 mm Hg
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was alert and intermittently cooperative, with poor verbal skills. Notable findings included facial angiofibromas and hypopigmented macules on the torso and arms.

physical_examinations.date: When the patient was 6 months of age
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Seizure activity developed and was treated with divalproex sodium.
Infantile spasms began, treated with vigabatrin.
Hypertension developed and was treated first with nifedipine and later with amlodipine.
Annual renal MRI showed a complex cyst in the lower pole of the left kidney with increased number and thickness of septations (from 1.8 cm to 3.0 to 3.4 cm).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Worsening in the complexity of the cyst.

physical_examinations.date: One month later (from annual MRI at 6.5 years)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: MRI showed no increase in the size of the complex cyst, but the cystic areas were smaller compared to the previous study. The central component appeared more solid and enhanced after gadolinium.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement in size of some cystic areas.

physical_examinations.date: When the patient was 7 years of age
physical_examinations.vital_signs: PPP: Normal complete blood count, renal, and liver function tests; normal levels of plasma electrolytes, glucose, calcium, magnesium, total protein, and albumin.
